DOC.brief_summary: Compared traditional open proctectomy , laparoscopic surgery associate less pain , early recovery , well cosmetic outcome , long-term oncologic outcome demonstrate . However , rate urinary dysfunction rectal cancer surgery 19-38 % mesorectal excision . The type drainage unclear . Some study show rate urinary tract infection , second catheterization , urinary symptom lower suprapubic catheterization ( SPC ) transurethral catheterization ( TUC ) . Moreover，SPC allow test bladder void without drainage removal . Furthermore，SPC use central venous catheter ( CVC ) less invasive . Currently , lack randomize control trial ( RCT ) compare SPC TUC . Therefore , investigator perform prospective randomize trial compare SPC use CVC TUC laparoscopic surgery rectal cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Multicenter Study Suprapubic Catheterization Versus Transurethral Catheterization Laparoscopic Surgery Rectal Cancer
